info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 04 at 3:18AM PDT until August 04 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Scattered to Numerous Afternoon and Evening Thunderstorms... .Increased coverage of thunderstorm activity is anticipated from the Cascades eastward and in Siskiyou County this afternoon and evening. Though activity will peak this evening, a slight chance to chance of thunderstorms will follow in much the same area on Saturday afternoon and evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 284... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop have a high probability of spreading rapidly. Abundant lightning under wetter storms can also ignite new fires and strain fire fighting resources. * AFFECTED AREA...The entire area of fire weather zone 284, covering eastern Siskiyou County. * THUNDERSTORMS...The probability of lightning within 25 miles of any point in the warning area is roughly 75 percent. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts up to 45 mph. * ADDITIONAL INFO...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.
